resources.string: More info at http://droidalyzer.com/ioiomatrix.html\n\nDesigned by Open Gadgets LLC
One Time Setup: Copying stock animations to your SD card.
Please ensure Bluetooth pairing has been completed prior. The Bluetooth pairing code is: 4545."

First pair your Android device to the Pixel LED frame which will show up as 'IOIO' in Bluetooth using code 4545.

Tap an animation to display it on the Pixel LED frame.

Follow the instructions below to add your own animations which are in animated gif format to this app:

Connect your Android device to your computer with a USB cable.

From your computer, open your Android device and copy your animated gifs to the pixelanimate folder located off the root of your SD card or internal storage if your device does not have a removeable SD card.

After done copying, select Rescan from this app's menu

You can also delete the sample animated gifs leaving only your own.

You'll get the best results by pre-scaling your animated gifs to 32x32 resolution and using a solid black background.

Animated gifs not in 32x32 resolution will be scaled automatically to 32x32. Animated gifs higher than 500x500 resolution may cause this app to crash and therefore it is recommended to use animated gifs of 300x300 resolution or lower.
Only animations in the pixelanimate directory from the root of your SD card will be displayed. Checking this box displays all SD card pictures.
Select your RGB LED Matrix model
Shortcut to the Bluetooth settings screen. Pair to IOIO using code: 4545
Forces the app to be always on, your device will not go into power savings mode while this app is running. Good if using as a Kiosk for example.
Now scanning your SD card or internal memory for new animations or deletions to the pixelanimation folder, just a moment…
Copying stock animations to your SD card or internal memory…
After this completes, select Instructions from the menu to use your own animations
You\'re still in slide show mode, swipe from right to left to end the slide show and then you can select a single image
